intro: Hedyotis tuyamae, commonly known as the Japanese pennywort, is a small perennial herb native to Japan. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family, which includes many species of shrubs and herbs. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as forests and stream banks. Its leaves are opposite, elliptical, and have a smooth surface with a slight waxy coating. Hedyotis tuyamae produces small, white or pale yellow flowers that are clustered in cymes, and it is often used in traditional herbal medicine.
